title: IMF upgrades UK growth forecast in another boost to new Labour government
content: The upgrades come after two years of stagnation, with the U.K. falling into a shallow recession in the second half of 2023.
summary: The upgrades come after two years of stagnation, with the U.K. falling into a shallow recession in the second half of 2023.

title: Trump 2.0 could be bad news for global inflation, analysts say
content: A second Trump presidency could reignite global inflation as his America-first policies drive up costs across the world, analysts warned.
summary: A second Trump presidency could reignite global inflation as his America-first policies drive up costs across the world, analysts warned.

title: Trump says he would let Fed Chair Powell finish his term if he wins in November, Bloomberg reports
content: Former President Donald Trump told Bloomberg Businessweek that he would let Fed chief Jerome Powell complete his term if he wins in November.
summary: Former President Donald Trump told Bloomberg Businessweek that he would let Fed chief Jerome Powell complete his term if he wins in November.

title: Money launderers are increasingly turning to crypto to conceal flow of funds, Chainalysis says
content: The report said these criminals are using crypto because crypto is "cross-border, virtually instant, and generally inexpensive to transact."
summary: The report said these criminals are using crypto because crypto is "cross-border, virtually instant, and generally inexpensive to transact."

title: Iran plot to kill Trump prompted Secret Service to boost protection before rally shooting
content: The Secret Service has faced criticism over the attempted assassination of Donald Trump by Thomas Crooks, weeks after learning of the Iran plot.
summary: The Secret Service has faced criticism over the attempted assassination of Donald Trump by Thomas Crooks, weeks after learning of the Iran plot.

title: 'Luxury shame': China's rich shy away from flaunting their wealth amid economic jitters
content: China's rich are cautious about flaunting their wealth as the economy faces headwinds, putting the country's luxury market under pressure.
summary: China's rich are cautious about flaunting their wealth as the economy faces headwinds, putting the country's luxury market under pressure.

title: From 'quiet quitting' to 'coffee badging' — why employees are less interested in work
content: Workers checking in at the office and then quickly checking back out is the latest symptom of growing employee disengagement.
summary: Workers checking in at the office and then quickly checking back out is the latest symptom of growing employee disengagement.

content: Regulators in the U.S. and abroad are increasingly zeroing in on tech companies' investments and partnerships with AI companies.

title: 'God help Ukraine': How JD Vance's VP nomination will cause chills in Kyiv

content: The iOS 18 preview is a beta version of the software that will launch alongside new iPhones this fall.

title: Microsoft's hiring of staff from AI startup Inflection referred for UK merger probe
content: Microsoft's hiring of employees from artificial intelligence startup Inflection has been referred for an initial merger investigation in the U.K.

title: IMF sees ‘bumps’ in path to lower inflation
content: Stubborn services and wage inflation will slow the pace of disinflation in the U.S. and globally, according to the IMF.
summary: Stubborn services and wage inflation will slow the pace of disinflation in the U.S. and globally, according to the IMF.

title: The next front in U.S.-China tech battle? Underwater cables that power the global internet
content: With tech tensions between the U.S. and China rising, vast networks of underwater cables are becoming a new source of strain in international relations.
summary: With tech tensions between the U.S. and China rising, vast networks of underwater cables are becoming a new source of strain in international relations.

title: Bank of America shares jump 5% after saying net interest income rebound is coming
content: Bank of America disclosed new guidance that net interest income, a key metric for banks, will rise to about $14.5 billion in the fourth quarter of this year.
summary: Bank of America disclosed new guidance that net interest income, a key metric for banks, will rise to about $14.5 billion in the fourth quarter of this year.

title: Andreessen Horowitz founders plan to donate to pro-Trump super PAC
content: Marc Andreessen and Ben Horowitz, co-founders of venture firm Andreessen Horowitz, plan to donate to PACs supporting Donald Trump's campaign.
summary: Marc Andreessen and Ben Horowitz, co-founders of venture firm Andreessen Horowitz, plan to donate to PACs supporting Donald Trump's campaign.

title: Man who claimed to be inventor of bitcoin referred to UK prosecutors for alleged perjury
content: A U.K. judge on Tuesday referred a case against Australian entrepreneur Craig Wright's claim to be the inventor of bitcoin to the Crown Prosecution Service.
summary: A U.K. judge on Tuesday referred a case against Australian entrepreneur Craig Wright's claim to be the inventor of bitcoin to the Crown Prosecution Service.

title: The Ambani wedding is costing millions — here's how to have a big impact on a much smaller budget

title: Morgan Stanley tops estimates on stronger-than-expected trading and investment banking

title: Deutsche Bank criticized by German regulator for financial reporting error
content: Deutsche Bank incorrectly disclosed deferred tax assets in its 2019 financial statement, German regulator BaFin said Tuesday.

content: Shares of Hugo Boss fell as much as 10% in morning trade Tuesday after the company cut its sales outlook.

title: Gareth Southgate steps down as England manager after Euro 2024 final defeat to Spain
content: The news comes two days after England's Euro 2024 final defeat to Spain.

title: Trump lauded at Republican convention, his first public appearance since assassination attempt
content: Trump wore a bandage over his right ear, but appeared to be in good spirits.As he walked into the convention, the Republican crowd erupted into cheering.

title: Foreign carmakers in China face 'increasingly precarious' position, consultancy says

title: Powell indicates Fed won't wait until inflation is down to 2% before cutting rates

content: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said the central bank will not wait until inflation hits 2% to cut interest rates.

title: Protests will 'absolutely' spread if European cities don’t address overtourism, says UNESCO official
